pxchat.gui
Class PaintBoard

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  pxchat.gui.PaintBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class PaintBoard
extends javax.swing.JPanel

This class implements a multi-layered drawing surface. It has either a background color or a background image as the lowest layer. The second layer is reserved for a queue of PaintObjects. The highest layer is used for a preview object and a cache of objects that have been drawn locally, but did not yet return from the server.

Author:
Florian Bausch, Robert Waury
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

serialVersionUID

private static final long serialVersionUID
See Also:
Constant Field Values

sentBackgrounds

private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> sentBackgrounds
A mapping of file names to image id of the background images already opened locally.

backgroundImgID

private java.lang.Integer backgroundImgID
The image id of the background image.

board

private java.awt.image.BufferedImage board
The second level of the paint board. The paint objects will be drawn into this image in order to avoid redrawing them every time the component has to be drawn.

doCompleteRepaint

private boolean doCompleteRepaint
If true, draws all objects in the backup list.

previewObject

private PaintObject previewObject
The current preview object. It will be drawn as the top layer each time the component is painted.

ingoing

private java.util.Vector<PaintObject> ingoing
A list of paint objects that were added to the paint board after the last call to updateBoard(). The elements of this list will be drawn and added to the backup list.

backup

private java.util.Vector<PaintObject> backup
A list of all paint objects that were added to the paint board. This list is used in the case of a complete redraw.

cache

private java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<PaintObject> cache
A cache of paint objects. They will be drawn as the top layer each time the component is painted. If an equal new paint object is added via the add(PaintObject) method, the object is removed from the cache. TODO: Maybe we should delete objects from the cache that are in it for too long. This should not happen, but maybe?

Constructor Detail

PaintBoard

public PaintBoard()
Constructs a new paint board.

Method Detail

add

public void add(PaintObject obj)
Adds a new paint object to the paint board. This method should be called whenever the server sends a new paint object. The incoming object will be removed from the cache.

Parameters:
obj - The paint object to add.

getCache

public java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<PaintObject> getCache()
Returns the cache of this paint board. The cache is used to draw paint objects that were added locally but did not yet return from the server. This avoids flickering and hides the latency.

Returns:
The cache

clearBoard

public void clearBoard(boolean clearBackup)
Clears the board by making it completely transparent. If clearBackup is true, the backup is cleared.

Parameters:
clearBackup - If true, the backup will be cleared too

getPreviewObject

public PaintObject getPreviewObject()
Returns the current preview object.

Returns:
The current preview object, or null if there is none

setPreviewObject

public void setPreviewObject(PaintObject obj)
Sets the current preview object. Removes the preview object if obj is null.

Parameters:
obj - The new preview object or null

loadBackground

public void loadBackground(java.awt.Color c)
Sets the background to the specified color

Parameters:
c - The new background color

loadBackground

public void loadBackground(java.io.File file)
Loads the image specified by file and down-samples it to fit the board without wasting memory. The background is not set by this function, it merely sends a BackgroundFrame to the server. If the image was not already loaded, a new ImageSender will be added to the client.

Parameters:
file - The file of the background image

loadBackground

public void loadBackground(int imageID)
Sets the background to the image associated with the specified image id.

Parameters:
imageID - The image id of the new background image

paintComponent

protected void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics og)
Overrides:
paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

saveImage

public java.awt.image.BufferedImage saveImage()
Saves the board to a BufferedImage

Returns:
The current PaintBoard

updateBoard

private void updateBoard()
Updates the actual board

repaint

public void repaint(boolean complete)
Repaints the component. If complete is true, the board will be cleared before all paint objects are painted. If complete is false, the paint objects added since the last call to repaint will be drawn.

Parameters:
complete - Indicates whether a complete repaint should be performed
